DOC.brief_summary: This study investigate effect dairy breakfast ( 2 % cow 's milk , 2 % Greek yogurt , cheese ) non-dairy breakfast ( soy beverage ) satiety post-meal blood glucose . Each participant receive every treatment crossover design study .
DOC.brief_title: The Effect Dairy Non-dairy Breakfasts Satiety Post-meal Glycemia Healthy Older Adults
DOC.detailed_description: Regular consumption dairy associate well body composition low incidence type 2 diabetes obesity . This may due dairy 's ability increase satiety decrease post-prandial glycemia . However , clinical study investigate isolated dairy protein ( whey casein ) effect whole dairy product , consume part meal , remain unclear . Additionally , effect dairy type form remain investigated . Therefore , study test effect dairy product consume high glycemic index breakfast satiety post-prandial glycemia . Thirty healthy old male female ( 60-70 year , BMI 18.5-30.0 kg/m2 ) recruit randomize , unblinded , crossover study . Participants fast overnight , baseline consume 1 ) 2 % milk ( 250 mL ) , 2 ) soy beverage ( 250 mL ) , 3 ) plain 2 % Greek yogurt ( 175 g ) , 4 ) cheddar cheese ( 30 g ) , 5 ) water ( 250 mL - control ) . Treatments consume along 2 piece white toast strawberry jam , except water control consume alone . All breakfast meal isocaloric water give yogurt ( 75 mL ) cheese ( 220 mL ) compensate fluid content . At 0 ( baseline ) , 15 , 30 , 45 , 60 , 90 , 120 , 150 , 180 , ( pre-meal period ) 210 minute ( post-meal period ) blood collect glucose analysis subjective appetite rating complete . Insulin analyze every 30 minute . Between 180-200 minute , ad libitum lunch provide assess food intake .
DOC.criteria: Healthy BMI ( 18.530.0 kg/m2 ) Regular breakfast consumer Menopausal least 1 year ( female ) Smoking Diabetes Fasting blood glucose equal high 6.0 mmol/L Cardiovascular disease Medication affect appetite metabolism Trying lose gain weight diet exercise regime Lactose intolerance allergy study food Score equal high 11 Eating Habits Questionnaire
